Subject: Re: AzureBlade, Mistra, and Kali! (Location: North Amercia)

AzureBlade: I do not recall that North America is Predacon Territory, 
and it isn't Maximal territory either. Neutral Terrain remains such. 
If you were mentionning my earlier venture near your base, then I 
would have to say that I am a Maximal, and that I consider helping my 
brethrens as my duty. And bravery, my esteemed Kali, is not difficult 
to find. Would you dare to stand up to your leaders because of what 
you think?

He looked at her intensely. She read open defiance, and he knew it. He 
just wished she could let them go. Besides, Prowl had told him about 
the non-agression pact. That could be the key.

AzureBlade: As for my friend Mistra, I believe she has already chosen. 
I will also refresh your memory, if you allow. Maximals and Predacons 
have agreed to non agression, right? If you do not let us go safely, 
this could mean war. Think, and you shall see you clearly do not want 
a war. Now step aside.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Airshadow Nightlight <airly2000@y...> wrote:
> 
>  Kali::
> Kali laughted as if she had heard a joke "Cowards won't survive in 
Predacon's world"said Kali"and neither in BlackFortress... Under the 
command of Darkfate you can be fool... but not coward... That's true 
as my name is Kali "Kali did a smile she knew that she had lost the 
bot but she liked to stay one second more, she knew that Azure was 
using diplomatic methods, that meant that she would be safe at least 
while she dind't pressed so much"So, Maximal,  did you went to Pred's 
territory, didn't you????? that's very brave; I should admit it, not 
all bots would do that... why did you go, anyway???"
>   HanaKirei85@a... wrote: AzureBlade: And who might you be, lady? 
You know it is unsafe to 
> travel alone in this forest. There are many wolves, and legends even 
> speak of a dreadful dragon. You should be more careful.Mistra was 
more than a little relieved to know Azure was here. Being by herself 
wouldn't have done her a bit of good in this situation...she didn't 
trust this supposed Predicon as far as she could throw her. Although 
the bot had been awfully quiet...maybe she was planning to give up..? 
> 
> Still, it was best to keep her guard up. Her eyes flickered to Azure 
for a split second, wondering just how much longer this tense scene 
was going to go on. 
> 
> "He's right...caution is best if you value your health." Mistra 
added.
